fields.description:
This is a suggestion to fill the gap for video files that are:
 * Too large for attachment (therefore the Media macro is not an option), and
 * Whose contents are too sensitive to be hosted online (therefore the Widget Connector macro is not an option)

This is justified through interest in the capability from 2011 to the present day: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Confluence-How-to-place-a-link-to-a-file-on-a-server-share-in-a/qaq-p/258790]
fields.summary: A macro to embed a video that is stored in an internal network

fields.description:
When customers reindex from scratch, they lose their popularity information for Confluence pages (and Confluence Questions) unless they manually copy over the edge index files.

The fact that the indices need to be manually copied over after a reindex from scratch is called out in step 7 of [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-rebuild-the-content-indexes-from-scratch-on-confluence-server-110035351.html], but is there a way we can avoid needing those manual steps?
fields.summary: Popularity indices should be regenerated automatically

fields.description:
Confluence system information returns all system environment variables and there is information that can be sensitive.

EG.
{quote}
SUDO_USER
SUDO_GID
SUDO_UID
USERNAME
LOGNAME
SHELL
USER
SUDO_COMMAND
HOSTNAME
HOME
{quote}

h4. Expected results

Confluence system information should bring only the information that is valuable to support and should avoid returning information such as SUDO variables and other server sensitive information.
fields.summary: System information shows sensitive server information

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 

* The *Confluence Usage Stats* plugin is known to cause performance problems in Confluence, especially in large instances. Some users need to use their information, though, and the information it retrieves is loaded dynamically when accessing a page where the plugin macros are at.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Provide a feature that can retrieve the information from the *Confluence Usage Stats* plugin and cache it, instead of dynamically load it. The time frame of the stored content can be defined by the user.

h3. Why this is important   

* This prevents the performance problem caused by this plugin and allows the users to use it as well.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Cache the information of the Confluence Usage Stats

h3. Expected Results

When there is a NullPointerException, we should be able to see in the logs the preceding stack/methods called, like this example:

	at java.util.Calendar.setTime(Calendar.java:1770)

{noformat}
We can see that this NPE was related to *com.atlassian.confluence.pages.BlogPost.getPostingCalendarDate*.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file, and it ends with *Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException*:

java.lang.RuntimeException: Listener: com.atlassian.confluence.links.RelatedContentRefactoringListener event: com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.page.PageMoveEvent
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:50)

	at com.atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceEventDispatcher$VCacheRequestContextRunnableFactory$1.lambda$run$0(ConfluenceEventDispatcher.java:93)

	at com.atlassian.confluence.vcache.VCacheRequestContextOperations.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextOperations.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceEventDispatcher$VCacheRequestContextRunnableFactory$1.run(ConfluenceEventDispatcher.java:93)

	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.publishPageMoveEvents(DefaultPageManager.java:1689)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Service desk users, unlicensed users, are unable to see links using labels, but they can see target pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Knowledgebase article link from the service desk to confluence.
 # Create a page 123 and add a label to page 321
 # Login to Confluence with service desk user.
 # Open the page 123 and observe that content is displayed, no permissions problem.
 # Then on the page click on label link 321

h3. Expected Results
Target page with url <baseurl>/label/space/123 will be displayed

h3. Actual Results
Page "no permissions" is displayed.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unlicensed users do not have permissions to use label links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence allows multiple excerpt macros to be added to the page, but the excerpt-include macro will only look at the first excerpt macro on the referenced page.

h3. Suggested solution

Our documentation on [Excerpt Macros|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/excerpt-macro-148062.html] says that:
{quote}
You can only define one excerpt per page. In other words, you can only add the Excerpt macro once to a page.
{quote}

We should modify the wording so that it says that although you can define more than one excerpt per page, the excerpt-include macro will only look at the top excerpt macro on the referenced page.
fields.summary: Update Excerpt macro documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copy-paste Confluence built-in emoticons to a new textual editor will display empty images or only show text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a few Confluence emoticons like "smiley"
# Publish the page.
# Copy the emoticons.
# Paste them in a new editor like a word or any textual editor.

h3. Expected Results
Emoticons will be visible in that editor.

h3. Actual Results
Emoticons are not visible. If they are pasted in the textual editor we will see the text "(smiley)" on the page instead of the image of smiley.

h3. Notes
Behavior was not observable in the Confluence 5.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copy paste Confluence built in emoticons to a new textual editor will display empty images or only show text.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the current Confluence Question permissions, you can only change the global permissions for CQ. This affects who is able to use Questions globally, but not per space.
h3. Suggested Solution

Admins don't necessarily want users to be able to ask questions in any space, so there should be some way to disable CQ on a single space.
h3.
fields.summary: As an admin, disable Questions on a particular Space

fields.description: I need to automate the process of fetching the list of users and their permissions level in a site space so that I can create a user report for the company client. Is it possible to provide this feature instead of installing a new plugin for this? Thank You!
fields.summary: Seeking API to fetch list of users in a given space.

fields.description:
h4. Problem
By default, Confluence sets its Code Cache sizing to 256m. The [Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217697/troubleshooting-and-support-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] was updated (version 1.21.0) to include a code cache health check, which fails if the size is less than 384m. As shipped, Confluence fails this health check.

h4. Solution
Change the default code cache JVM parameters as shown:
{code}
-XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=384m and -XX:+UseCodeCacheFlushing
{code}
fields.summary: Increase default -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize= value in Confluence to 384m to match Atlassian Support Tools sizing

fields.description:
Currently, if a file, such as an image file, is uploaded to a Confluence page, the apache commons-fileupload process spins off tmp files in the <confluence-home>/temp directory. As part of this process, the file names for these files will include a randomly generated alphanumeric unique key. Unfortunately, this has no tie back to the actual page that the file was uploaded to.

As such, if one of these uploaded files is flagged by anti-virus software as having a virus, then it's very difficult to trace where in the Confluence content this file exists.

This request is to record the page ID or content ID of the page receiving the file in the tmp file's file name so that an administrator can then inspect the page to see if the infected file is present.
fields.summary: Add page metadata to tmp files created as part of file upload process

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Making an inline comment on a sorted table does not stay on the associated row

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table with 2 columns and some rows.
 # Make some comments on the table. Observe the row the comment is made on.
 !Ex1.png|thumbnail! 
# Sort a column and observe the comment is still associated with row
 !Ex2.png|thumbnail! 
# Make new inline comment. Observe the row the comment is made on. 
 !Ex3.png|thumbnail! 
# Refresh the page. Observe the row that the comment is made on now.
 !Ex4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Expect the comment to stay associated to the row that is was made on regardless of the sorting that was done on the table.

h3. Actual Results
Comments are not associated to the row

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Making an inline comment on a sorted table does not stay on the associated row

fields.description:
When managing a large space/ organization it would be a good feature to be able to share viewing rights of pages with people outside of the permission scheme of the page tree / space. 

The way it is currently done within our organization is to set up two top-level areas. One public and one private within the same space. This approach means a lot of copy-pasting between the two areas to keep them in sync, which creates a lot of manual work for space administrators.
fields.summary: As a Confluence Space administrator I would like to be able to create public pages within my space

fields.description: In line with the native application for Jira Cloud on macOS ([https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-software/jira-cloud-app-for-mac]), a native Mac app for Confluence would be great to see.
fields.summary: Native app for Confluence Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Disabling SAML override in Confluence DC, to ensure no users can log in to Confluence via SAML/SSO only, still allows users to use default login URL and access the instance with local credentials.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Confluence DC with SAML/SSO (steps not covered here)
 # Disable SAML override by setting
{code:json}
{
  "allow-saml-redirect-override": false
}{code}
to
 _false_ via REST Call to {{[https://localhost:PORT/contextPath/rest/authconfig/1.0/saml]}} URL

 * For reference: [Enable Default Login Page To Bypass Saml In Confluence Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/enable-default-login-page-to-bypass-saml-in-confluence-data-center-957972845.html]

h3. Expected Results

Once {{allow-saml-redirect-override}} is set to _false_, it's expected the default login page redirects the request do the Idp and allow *no* further local users to log in to Confluence.
h3. Actual Results

Users *still* able to access Confluence using local credentials via {{[https://localhost:PORT/contextPath/dologin.action]}}
 or
 {{[https://localhost:PORT/contextPath/dologin.action?auth_fallback]}}
h3. Workaround
 # The default login URL can be blocked at the Tomcat level, using the instructions in this KB:
 [How to block access to a specific URL at Tomcat|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-block-access-to-a-specific-url-at-tomcat-966668691.html]
 # The URL can also be blocked or redirected at the proxy.

(!) *Note:* To enable the [auth_fallback URL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/enable-auth_fallback-to-bypass-saml-in-confluence-data-center-958442925.html] during maintenance windows, the URL blocking workarounds will need to be reverted.
fields.summary: Disabling SAML override in Confluence Data Center doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a page that contains sections, if during text selection in the section the mouse pointer is moved to outside the section limits and the left-button is released there, the cursor jumps to the top of section.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and add at least 2 sections;
 # In the second section add several lines of text;
 # Use the mouse to select text and with left-button pressed, move the cursor/pointer to outside the section width, either left or right;
 # With the pointer outside the section, release left-button.

h3. Expected Results

Highlighted/selected text is kept and cursor stays at the end of the selected text (right or left, depending on the direction used when moving the mouse pointer).
h3. Actual Results

No text is selected/highlighted and the cursor jumps to the top of the section.
This can result in accidental content when entering text, as the new text will be added on top of section and not replacing highlighted text as expected and this might go unnoticed.

Please check attached screen recording [^SectionHighlight-recording.mp4]
h3. Workaround

As the issue has been only observed using Chrome, use a different browser to avoid the problem.
h3. Notes

The issue has only be observed using Chrome and it does not occur when using IE, Edge or Firefox.
fields.summary: Moving the pointer past the page limit when selecting content in a section causes the cursor to jump to top of the section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Macro Title is missing when copy pasting the same macro in a page and closing the page without updating it (Unpublished changes). 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and add 'Column' macro
# Save the page
# Edit the page
# Copy & paste the same 'Column' macro in the page
# Close the page without updating it
# Edit the page again 'Unpublished changes'

[^Recording #30.mp4]

h3. Expected Results
 !image-2019-11-15-11-26-47-724.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 !image-2019-11-15-11-26-32-178.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Update the page to see the Macro title.

Note: *Affected macros* - Excerpt, Column, Code Block, Section
fields.summary: Macro Title missing when copy pasting the same macro in 'Unpublished Changes'

fields.description:
The multimedia macro has some controls to supposedly set the size of the file .. all that seems to do is control the size of the black background box, but not the size of playing window :(

The playing window seems to be a fixed size with what seems to be a non-functioning "Full Screen" size button.

So what I see is a video occupying ~25% of my screen - I have to zoom my complete browser window to get something that is view-able

It seems that you just need to enable the View Full Screen button

Also seems a similar issue reported here has been closed to lack of interest :(

In my case I am managing a Confluence instance with 5000 Users and we are about to launch various video files so please count my single vote as 5000 votes!!  I hope that is interest enough???

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34159
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro should have option for viewers to view as full screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some of the Confluence Server macros do not have a wiki markup example, so it's not clear if it's possible to insert using wiki markup.

There _is_ however, an example of parameters which mentions inserting into the page using wiki markup
 * [+Page Properties Macro+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-properties-macro-184550024.html]
 * [+Page Properties Report Macro+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-properties-report-macro-186089616.html]

h3. Suggested Edit

Include wiki markup example, or state clearly if it's not possible.
fields.summary: Page Properties Macros have no wiki markup example in documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For the View File Macros, such as:
 * [+Office Excel Macro+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-excel-macro-375849173.html]

 * [+Office PowerPoint Macro+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-powerpoint-macro-375849178.html]

 * [+Office Word Macro+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-word-macro-375849176.html]

 * [PDF Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/pdf-macro-375849180.html]

The parameters are listed on a separate page: [View File Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/view-file-macro-170494360.html]

It does state on the page that for more details, read the View File Macro documentation, but it's not clear that is also where the parameters for these macros are listed.
h3. Suggested Edit

Add some text to clarify this, e.g. For a list of parameters, please see [View File Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/view-file-macro-170494360.html]
fields.summary: Make it more obvious where to find parameters in View File macros

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For some macros, there is no documented wiki markup or parameters section like there is for other Confluence macros ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/macros-139387.html])
 * [Jira Chart Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/jira-chart-macro-427623467.html] - there is no documented wiki markup or parameters section like there is for other Confluence macros
 * +[Content by Label Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/content-by-label-macro-145566.html]+ - Same as above, has Macro Display Options, no wiki markup, and it's not clear if those parameters could be used in any possible wiki markup

h3. Suggested Edit

State clearly whether it's possible to add the chart macro to a page with wiki markup and if there are any parameters that can be used.
fields.summary: Some macros have no documented parameters or wiki markup example

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On a few of the documentation pages for Confluence macros, there is either no *Parameters* section, or there is one, but it's called *Macro Display Options* instead.
 * [+HTML Macro+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/html-macro-38273085.html] - There's a note that says there are no Parameters, but it's not under a **Parameters heading, like some macros have even when there aren't any.
 * [Favorite Pages Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/favorite-pages-macro-148581.html] - Same as above

 * [Page Index Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-index-macro-182682092.html] - Same as above

h3.  Suggested Edit

Rename *Macro Display Options* to *Parameters* to match other documentation pages
fields.summary: No Parameters heading on the documentation for some macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the Confluence Server Macros documentation ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/macros-139387.html]), *Activity Stream Macro* no longer has its own documentation and links straight to the Gadgets documentation ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/gadgets-204047542.html])

In addition, as of +Confluence 7.0+, support has been ended for this macro according to the Activity Stream Gadget documentation ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/activity-stream-gadget-218275789.html])
h3. Suggested Edit

Either remove the macro from the listing of gadgets for the current documentation, or point it directly to the Activity Stream Gadget documentation instead.
fields.summary: Activity Stream documentation points to Gadgets documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Merging cells is not working as expected when there are multiple cells merged already in the table. see screenshot
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table 3x6
 # Merge few cells in the table (refer to attached screenshot)
 # Attempt to merge 4 cells from the last column, table breaks

h3. Expected Results

Merging cells in the table should work as expected
h3. Actual Results
Can't merge the cells as the table breaks when attempting to merge (see screenshot)

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no workaround
fields.summary: Merging cells using page editor doesn't work as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If multiple directories have same group name with difference letter case (e.g. _group1_ against _GROUP1_ ), spaces which has permission against the group don't hit on the search.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create _user1_ and _group1_ on an internal directory
 # Create _user1_ and _GROUP1_ on a LDAP server
 # Grant "Use Confluence" permission to _group1_ 
 # Create _group1space_ space and grant a permission to _group1_ 
 # Add LDAP server on step 2 as an external directory and bring it to highest priority
 # Login as _user1_ with LDAP password
 # Search _group1*_

h3. Expected Results
_group1space_ is shown in the list
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-14 at 10.58.27.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The space is not in the list
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-14 at 10.59.43.png|thumbnail! 
 Also, you see "Case incorrect. Correct case is: GROUP1 "
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-14 at 11.00.13.png|thumbnail! 

Although the _user1_ can look the page of _group1space_ if they entered the URL directly.

h3. Workaround
Avoid duplicated group name removing _group1_ from internal directory and configure the permission again.
fields.summary: Some spaces don't hit on search if group name is duplicated in internal and external directory with difference letter case

fields.description: As confluence becomes critical to organization, its important to have this available all the time. However, for any reason there might be a unplanned downtime and business gets affected. Natively, Confluence does not have mirroring concept. The request is to build a native capability in Confluence to mirror entire site or spaces in read-only format (ideally data should be available to the mirror site in real time). This is not a DR site but a redundant site always available to users irrespective of main confluence availability.
fields.summary: Confluence Redundancy

fields.description:
The usefulness of Confluence's daily update email would increase dramatically if it did not include the link to compare to the previous version, but the version of the previous day per changed page.
Currently you have to check each time, if the previous version may be from the same day. Then you have to go to the versions, select the last version of the previous day to compare them with the current one.
Only then can you really get all the changes.
Currently, it may be that the linked update is just the addition of a comma, but the page has changed drastically compared to the previous day.
fields.summary: Daily update email with link to the day before

fields.description:
In companies where authentication is based on the cookies, if the cookie does not exist the login page will be shown. It would be beneficial to include cookies in this communication in order to prevent problems when downloading attachments.

Below, is the example of negotiation flow:
1. The last command instructs the client to download the document file from a URL.
2. The URL contains the credentials required to authenticate to Confluence via a provided JWT query string.
3. The Companion app then tries to download the document from the given URL.
4. Since it does not inherit browser cookies and they are not passed to it in any way the document that is downloaded contains our login page.
fields.summary: Ability to use cookies in Companion APP communication to Confluence in order to authenticate.
SOAP API removeUser needs to be able to delete users with content as can be done through the UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cannot edit content created by deleted Slack/Confluence user.
 * Confluence Server
 * [Confluence Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220186/confluence-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=versions] plugin v2.0+

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*As an administrator:*
 * Connect Confluence to Slack: [Use Slack and Confluence together|https://confluence.atlassian.com/slack/use-slack-and-confluence-together-966662503.html]

*Log in as a Confluence user:*
 # Configure *personal* notifications with Slack (tying a space to a channel and user)
 # Create some content with that user (user automatically watches that content)
 # Confirm that you get notifications in Slack anytime that page/space is updated

*As an administrator:*
 # Go to  !http://i.imgur.com/Ew0T0kz.png! *User Management*
 # Delete the user
 # Try editing a page that the user created

h3. Expected Results

Changes are saved.
h3. Actual Results

No user's can edit this page, the following error is thrown in the browser:
 *Unable to communicate with server. Saving is not possible at the moment.*

And this error is seen in the logs:
{noformat}
2019-11-12 16:15:22,034 ERROR [https-jsse-nio2-8443-exec-2] [atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceEventDispatcher] run There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event [com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.page.PageUpdateEvent@7298a378[originalPage=page: page created by dponzio v.1 (1343565),updateTrigger=EDIT_PAGE,page=page: page created by dponzio v.2 (1343558),suppressNotifications=false,timestamp=1573596922031]] from the invoker [SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker{method=public void com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.slack.spacetochannel.listener.ConfluenceEventListener.pageUpdateEvent(com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.page.PageUpdateEvent), listener=com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.slack.spacetochannel.listener.ConfluenceEventListener@1cc9a7be} (timed)]
 -- referer: https://connietesting.com:8443/pages/editpage.action?pageId=1343558 | url: /rest/api/content/1343558 | traceId: 701d204ad20c0e2d | userName: admin
java.lang.RuntimeException: No user exists with the user key 4028d6e46e5c22ee016e6160a2f70004. Listener: com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.slack.spacetochannel.listener.ConfluenceEventListener event: com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.page.PageUpdateEvent
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Disable the *Confluencer Server for Slack plugin*, or downgrade to version 1.1.12
fields.summary: Cannot edit content created by a deleted Slack/Confluence user

fields.summary: Support for PostgreSQL 12

fields.description:
It seems that email notifications for FULL DAY EVENTS are sent at 0:00 am....that wakes up people.

Can we have the ability to specify the reminders (this all form of reminders) for event types to the minute? (e.g. 21:00 n day(s) before) - similar to Google calendar.

If more than one notification could be set (this is also for part time events), that would be a bonus.

We get many complaints.

thanks
fields.summary: Ability to define reminder TIME of events (esp. FULL DAY)
Enhance Confluence WebDAV Plugin Logging Capabilities

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the [Create from Template|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/create-from-template-macro-317196995.html] macro, if the space key entered in the parameters is '0', then the specified template is not used. Instead, you will see the generic Create Page screen.

As a result of this, the specified title will also not be used.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space, set the space key to 0
 # Create a new page, and add the Create from Template macro. Choose any desired template.
 # Set the Space Key in parameters to the space you just created, 0.
 # Save page.
 # Try to create a page from the macro.

h3. Expected Results

Desired template should be used, along with any other parameters that were entered.
h3. Actual Results

Sent to Create Page dialogue.
h3. Workaround

No current workaround. The space key will need to be renamed following the [Copy Space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-copy-or-rename-a-space-in-confluence-169578.html] procedure.
h3. Notes

This only occurs when the space key is just the number '0'. It does not occur with the following circumstances:
 # Any other single digit
 # Any combination of numbers, including ones that start or end with 0
fields.summary: Create from Template macro does not use specified macro parameters when space key is set to '0'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Numbered list displayed incorrectly on Firefox
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Add numbered list to the page ( [refer to the storage format|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/380256/Numbered%20List.txt] )

h3. Expected Results

Numbering sequence is correct (1,2,3,4)
 !image-2019-11-11-16-29-27-819.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Numbering sequence is incorrect (1,3,3,6)
 !image-2019-11-11-16-29-44-100.png|thumbnail!

This is because the numbered list follows the sub numbered list from the previous numbered list.
{quote}1. Line 1
 a. Line 1.1
 b. Line 1.2
 3. Line 1.3
{quote}

h3. Workaround

This issue is caused by invalid HTML. Manually edit page to reenter numbered list, ensuring there are no <ol> or <ul> elements directly under other <ol> or <ul> elements. If there are, they should be wrapped in an <li> element as per the HTML specification.
fields.summary: Numbered list displayed incorrectly on Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having a draft to a page where there's a specific user mentioned, if this user is deleted, it will not be possible to publish the draft.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Mention a specific user on a page and publish it
# Edit the page and close it without publishing
# Delete that specific user
# Try to publish that draft

h3. Expected Results
The draft should be published

h3. Actual Results
The draft is not published, the message "There was an error processing the request." is shown on the page and on the browser's console:
|  !Screen Shot 2019-04-10 at 16.59.31.png|thumbnail!  |
{code}jquery-min.js:1 PUT https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/789545067?status=draft 400{code}
Errors on internal log:
{code:none}Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: Could not unmarshal a link in the editor.	{code}

h3. Notes
This is noticed on the legacy editor only.

h3. Workaround
Remove the former user's mention, refresh the page a couple of times and try to publish it again.
fields.summary: Not able to publish draft when there's a former user mentioned
SAML AuthnRequest should be signed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
# Page selection for custom exports broken when the total number of pages in the Space is high.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 11,000 pages, and split them under two parent pages, like so,
** {noformat}
+--- Space Home
|   +--- Parent 1
|   |   +--- 5,500 sub pages
|   +--- Parent 2
|   |   +--- 5,500 sub pages
{noformat}
# Go to *Space Tools >> Content Tools >> Export >> Export PDF*
# Try a custom export, and selecting just Parent 1 and the pages under it, and just those pages would be exported.
# Try a custom export, and select Parent 2, and the pages under it, and it will export only around 2000 or so of the pages.
# If you were to add another sub page tree under Parent 2, and try exporting just the 500 pages with the parent page, instead of 501 pages, it will start exporting over 600 or so pages.
** This number changes depending on the position of the sub page and the number of sub pages.
** {noformat}
+--- Space Home
|   +--- Parent 1
|   |   +--- 5,500 sub pages
|   +--- Parent 2
|   |   +--- 5,500 sub pages
|   |    |     + 500 sub pages.
{noformat}
# (/) An interesting thing to note is that if we were to move this 500 page and it's parent to the top of the Page tree, and selecting it, the number of pages being exported is correct.
** So it seems the page selection is broken near the bottom of the list of pages.

h3. Expected Results
# The number of pages being exported should match the number of pages that is selected(ticked) in the custom export.

h3. Actual Results
# The number of pages being exported is different, sometimes more, and sometimes less than the number of pages that is selected.

h3. Workaround
# Currently, if we were to move the pages to the top of the Page tree, the export seems to work as expected.
fields.summary: Page selection for custom exports broken when there's a lot of pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Macro enabled excel workbook is not editable whereas normal workbook without any macros enabled seems to work fine. This issue is only observed while running Office 2013 whereas the issue is not reproducible while using Office 365

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Upload macro enabled excel workbook on a Confluence page.
* Editing and clicking the radio button within the workbook doesn't have any effect, meaning file is basically not editable.

h3. Expected Results

Macro enabled file should be editable in Office 2013

h3. Actual Results

Macro enabled file is not editable in Office 2013

h3. Workaround

Download the file, edit the macro enabled file locally using Office 2013 and re-upload the attachment back to the Confluence page.

h3. Issue Summary Space Export to HTML does not come with images in Include Page Macro pointed to a different Space h3. Environment Confluence 6.12.4 Confluence 7.0.3 h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new space named SpaceA # Create a new page in SpaceA named PageA # Upload an image to PageA and publish it so the image is shown in the view mode # Create another new space named SpaceB # Create a new page in SpaceB named PageB # Insert an [Include Page Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/include-page-macro-139514.html] in PageB that points to PageA # Publish PageB so the image in PageA should now show in PageB {code:title=PageB Storage Format}

{code} # Export SpaceB into *HTML* format and open up the exported PageB h3. Expected Results The image that is seen in PageB from the Confluence is also seen in the HTML Page Export h3. Actual Results The image is displayed as a Broken Image in the HTML Page Export h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available h3. Information By inspecting the HTML File for the exported page, the image attachment can be found as below: {code}

{code} If the attachment is manually created in {{*attachments/1179681/1179695.jpg*}}, it can be shown in the HTML so if Confluence has included the image in the HTML Page Export, this page would displayed with the image properly.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition When inserting Jira Issue Macro with multiple issues (JIM as a table), the *Columns to display* is always fixed in the list and sequence below: # Key # Summary # Issue Type # Created # Updated # Due Date # Assignee # Reporter # Priority # Status # Resolution They can also be seen in the Storage Format below, specifically in the *columns* row: {code}

Jira key,summary,type,created,updated,due,assignee,reporter,priority,status,resolution 20 project = pm 91d5bc7f-024c-3c64-9b78-47be6976c9f0

{code} !Columns to display.png|thumbnail! Although user can edit the list of *Columns to display* on each of the Jira Issue Macro, but it is not possible to have a customized set to be *Default* so that every time a Jira Isse Macro is inserted, the customized default Columns to display is always used. Having to edit each and every Jira Issue Macro everytime a user inserts one can sum up to be a huge overhead h3. Suggested Solution Allowing user or admin to change the default set of *Columns to display* for Jira Issue Macro in Confluence h3. Possible Workaround As a workround, user can copy & paste the edited Jira Issue Macro then edit JQL part to display a different list of issues. This can be done via: * Copy the Jira Issue Macro in the Page Editor directly * Copy the Storage Format of the edit Jira Issue Macro by making use of the [source editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor?hosting=server&tab=overview] and paste the edited storage format back to the page
fields.summary: Ability to define default Columns to display in Jira Issue Macro Table

fields.description:
As of now, Confluence does not have a feature to allow Confluence Administrator to restrict the options of permissions that Space Admin could grant towards the users/anonymous access. 

For example, when a Confluence Administrator wants Space Admin to only have the ability to control (enable/disable) the {{view}} permission of a space. It is not achievable right now as there exist no configurations for Confluence Administrator to restrict the permissions that Space Admin owns.

h3. Issue Summary

When doing a search for text that is present in a attached Word document that has a Table of Contents, the search results display the formatting code from the Table of Contents and not only the visible text, as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the attached Word document  [^TableOfContents.docx] to a Confluence Space;
 # Enter in the Search box the text "Summary".

h3. Expected Results

The Word document {{TableOfContents.docx}} is listed showing part of the Table of Contents, similar to how it works in Confluence Cloud:
 !Search-Cloud.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The Word document is listed but the text displayed includes the internal formatting text of the Table of Contents, as seen in the screenshot:
 !Search-Server.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Search results from an attached Word document's Table of Contents are displayed with internal formatting text

fields.description:
If we start the installation process and after entering the license information and during the DB setup, we try to open the Confluence instance, we will get an error 500 messages, and DB will get corrupted. The issue is also visible if we migrate instances from the Server to DC.

The only solution, in that case, would be to destroy the data in db, delete confluence.cfg.xml and restart the instance.

This can happen due to multiple reasons, like monitoring tool, or load balancer checks.

Therefore it would be good to have a safety mechanism, that would redirect the Confluence request, for example, based on session, to a static page until installation is finished.
fields.summary: Improve installation process by preventing any other request to brake installation.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence has a ["Share a link" template |https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/shared-links-template-937893685.html] that allows users to take content from the web and place it in a Confluence page.

Some links that contains space (%20) will not work with the blueprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that Confluence has [whitelist disabled|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-the-whitelist-381255821.html] for this replication
# Create page from blueprint > Choose "Share a link"
# Find a link that cotains space. (Sample link provided on CSP-261395)
# The "Share a link" popup will appear. Paste the sample link on the "Link" field. Example (not a working link)
{noformat}
http://www.example.com/Upload/A%20sample%20doc.PDF
{noformat}
# Add title and click on the "create" button

h3. Expected Results
The page is created

h3. Actual Results
Page is not created. Seeing the following error message on the page:

{noformat}
We can't create that blueprint right now.
{noformat}

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2019-11-05 10:59:00,803 ERROR [http-nio-26157-exec-1] [plugins.sharelinks.metaextractor.MasterLinkMetaDataExtractor] getHeadHtmlData Error in parse data: 
 -- referer: http://localhost:26157/display/~admin/test | url: /rest/create-dialog/1.0/content-blueprint/create-content | traceId: 877f4973116ffdf8 | userName: admin
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 9: /Upload/1 Stock Preparation & Approach System 2010.PDF
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.http.httpclient.HttpClientHttpResponse.getResponseURI(HttpClientHttpResponse.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharelinks.metaextractor.MasterLinkMetaDataExtractor.getResponseURI(MasterLinkMetaDataExtractor.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharelinks.metaextractor.MasterLinkMetaDataExtractor.getHeadHtmlData(MasterLinkMetaDataExtractor.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharelinks.metaextractor.MasterLinkMetaDataExtractor.parseMetaData(MasterLinkMetaDataExtractor.java:71)
....
Caused by: java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 9: /Upload/A sample doc.PDF
	at java.net.URI$Parser.fail(URI.java:2848)
	at java.net.URI$Parser.checkChars(URI.java:3021)
....
{noformat}

Upon checking the browser console, the link is getting 500 error:
{code}
Request URL:http://localhost:26157/rest/sharelinks/1.0/link?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.example.com.tw%2FUpload%2FA%2520sample%2520doc.PDF&_=1572922738734
Request method:GET
Remote address:127.0.0.1:26157
Status code:
500
Version:HTTP/1.1
Referrer Policy:no-referrer-when-downgrade
{code}

h5. Notes
This issue was seen on external PDF links that contains space or %20. More examples can be seen from CSP-261395

The issue does not exists with PDF links that contians spaces from Confluence. 

Upon checking, working links are encoded to %2520 in the browser console

h3. Workaround
Before adding the link into the field, change all occurrence of "%20" into "%2520".

Example, the link mentioned above will become the following:
{code}
http://www.example.com/Upload/A%2520sample%2520doc.PDF
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to create a Share Links page with certain links that contains space
The path [${confluence.context.path}/synchrony-proxy] does not meet these criteria and has been changed to [/${confluence.context.path}/synchrony-proxy]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor] button may not show up upon loading the page editor.

h3. Environment

* Confluence Source Editor plugin version 2.0.0.
* Confluence Data Center version 6.13.8 - affecting Pages.
* Confluence Server version 6.13.7 - affecting User and Global Templates, does not affect Pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

For Data Center:
 # Install the Confluence Source Editor version 2.0.0 in a Data Center 6.13.8 environment.
 # Navigate to a page and click on Edit.

For Server:
 # Install the Confluence Source Editor version 2.0.0 in a Server 6.13.7 environment.
 # Navigate to a User Template or Global Template and click on Edit.

h3. Expected Results

The page editor will show the Source Editor < > icon in the top right indicating the source editor has loaded 
 !image-2019-10-30-10-43-15-558.png!
h3. Actual Results

The < > icon may be missing upon loading the page editor. Subsequent attempts to load the page editor may succeed in loading the source editor or may not. 

h3. Workaround

Downgrade to the 1.1.3 version of the Confluence Source Editor plugin.

h3. Notes
Following the steps in [Confluence Source Editor Button Is Not Visible During Page Edit|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-source-editor-button-is-not-visible-during-page-edit-733940215.html] did not resolve this, but are an appropriate step to try when troubleshooting this issue.
fields.summary: Confluence Source Editor button not showing up

fields.description:
Currently, Confluence does not allow user to search for pages/spaces created by deleted/disabled user using the username of the deleted/disabled user. User is only able to search pages/spaces created by delete/disabled user with the page titles. This will cause difficulties for the admin to keep track of the pages/spaces created by deleted/disabled user.
For Example:
*Tim* created a few pages in Confluence and the Confluence admin has deleted/disabled *Tim's* user account.
*Mark* is able to search the page created by *Tim* using the page title. However, when *Mark* tries to search the pages/spaces created by *Tim* with entering *Tim's* username in the *contributor* field in the search filter. The search result will not return pages created by *Tim*.
fields.summary: Ability to search content by deleted username

fields.description: Confluence should support dark mode using the {{prefers-color-scheme}} CSS media selector [https://drafts.csswg.org/mediaqueries-5/#prefers-color-scheme|https://drafts.csswg.org/mediaqueries-5/#prefers-color-scheme]. More information including browser adoption can be found at [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/prefers-color-scheme|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/prefers-color-scheme].
fields.summary: Support dark mode in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team Calendars' '[Restrict a Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/restrict-a-calendar-660737259.html]' documentation explains how to restrict viewing and/or editing.

However, the documentation does not make clear that the Restrictions were designed in a way that the calendar creator has the privilege to keep control over the calendar even if the restrictions are modified, which can cause confusion for the customers.

This mean they can always edit/view a calendar they created, change its name, change the related space, etc.
h3. How to Improve

Although this is a design choice to avoid other users taking full control of calendars they have not created, the inclusion of a paragraph explaining that calendar creators cannot be restricted helps to clarify this.
fields.summary: Improve 'Restrict a Calendar' documentation to explain that calendar owners cannot be restricted

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Migrating Confluence between supported Database platforms (MySQL, Postgres, SQL Server, Oracle) requires using the XML backup process (a time and resource intensive process).

h3. Suggested Solution
Add functionality similar to the Bitbucket Server Database Migration Wizard (see [Connecting Bitbucket Server to an external database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/connecting-bitbucket-server-to-an-external-database-776640378.html])
fields.summary: Add Migration Wizard to move data between different database types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using *Anchors* or *Table of Content macro* the jump to the content doesn't include the content header.

Reproduced with Confluence 6.13.4 and Confluence 6.13.8.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a lot of text separated by a few headings.
 ** Or use sample page:  [^Anchor and ToC macro page] 
 # Click any of the links in the Table of Contents macro or the Anchor link (in the sample page the anchor link is in the "For more information please *see more details here.*" sentence)

h3. Expected Results

When clicking the link we would expect to see the content header and the content itself:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-29 at 10.58.58.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

When clicking the link, the anchor actually skips the header and jumps to the content immediately below the header:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-29 at 10.59.38.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
Use Firefox or IE as issue only reproducible on Chrome for now.
fields.summary: Clicking the Anchor or Table of Content macro links jumps to the content but doesn't include the content header

fields.description:
h3.The request
Currently, Unlicensed users and Active Jira users are not able to view the content from a Jira Calendar embed in a Knowledgebase article Confluence page. It would be nice if they would be able to see the content of the events in the calendar, instead of a blank one. 

h3.Steps to replicate
# [Allow Unlicensed Access to users from Jira Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/give-access-to-unlicensed-users-from-jira-service-desk-827106210.html]
# Create a knowledgebase page with a Team Calendar on it
# Visit the Knowledgebase article

h3.Expected Behavior
The user is able to see the public events on the calendar

h3.Actual behavior
The calendar is completely empty
fields.summary: Allow Unlicensed Users to view Team Calendar's events

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Selecting *jpg* for image format in "Chart Macro" properties results an error, the macro cannot be rendered and shows the following error instead:
{code:java}
Error rendering macro 'chart' - javax.imageio.IIOException: Invalid argument to native writeImage"
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or edit a page
 # Insert Chart Macro
 # Edit properties > select JPG under "Image format"
 # Shows error "Error rendering macro 'chart' - javax.imageio.IIOException: Invalid argument to native writeImage"

h3. Expected Results

Chart Macro should render properly when selecting JPG under image format
h3. Actual Results

Chart Macro is not rendered and instead shows an error when *JPG* is selected for image format under properties
{code:java}
"Error rendering macro 'chart' - javax.imageio.IIOException: Invalid argument to native writeImage"
{code}

h3.  *Additional Notes*

In some later recent versions of Confluence like (7.6.1), a 0 byte JPG image is rendered and we will see a broken image like follows.
 !chart-1.png|thumbnail! 

Analysing HAR file shows that PNG is rendered properly, but JPG results in a 0 byte image.
{code:title=PNG}
        "request": {
          "method": "GET",
          "url": "http://localhost:8090/download/temp/chart5847754948494120556.png",
          "httpVersion": "HTTP/1.1",
          .
      "response": {
          "status": 200,
          .
        "content": {
            "size": 7464,
            "mimeType": "application/x-download",
            "compression": -1,
            "text": "iVBORw..." 
           "encoding": "base64"
{code}

{code:title=JPG}
        "request": {
          "method": "GET",
          "url": "http://localhost:8090/download/temp/chart8151348835492516659.jpg",
          "httpVersion": "HTTP/1.1",
          .
      "response": {
          "status": 200,
          .
        "content": {
            "size": 0,
            "mimeType": "application/x-download",
            "compression": -1,
            "text": "",
            "encoding": "base64"
{code}


h3. Workaround

Select PNG in image format instead of jpg under Chart Macro properties
fields.summary: Chart Macro doesn't render in JPG

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira Roadmap gadget in Confluence shows labels that aren't being properly transformed into the "friendly" versions. For example, instead of showing "1 of 2 issues resolved", the gadget shows "MSG_gadget.roadmap.issues.resolved".

h3.Environment
* Confluence 6.15.8
* Jira Core and Jira Software 8.4.1
* Both applications running under HTTP 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between Confluence and Jira (with Jira Software installed)
# Create a software project in Jira and generate data with multiple issue versions 
# Resolve an issue with and without a resolution. The following JQL should return results:
\\
{code}
project = PROJECTNAME AND fixVersion = "Version 2" AND resolution is not EMPTY
{code}
{code}
project = PROJECTNAME AND fixVersion = "Version 2" AND resolution is EMPTY
{code} 
# Add the Jira Roadmap gadget to Confluence:
\\
{code}
JIRABASEURL/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:road-map-gadget/gadgets/roadmap-gadget.xml	
{code}
# Add the roadmap gadget to Confluence

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should show all the proper labels. For example: [^roadmap-on-jira.png]

h3. Actual Results
The gadget shows untransformed labels. For example: [^roadmap-on-confluence.png]

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Roadmap gadget shows MSG_gadget.roadmap.issues.resolved
Confluence displays wrong GMT on User Profile when under Daylight Savings

fields.description:
In CONFSERVER-45045, the fix for the Request Access feature states that:
{quote}Basically two things were updated:

Before the update we always sent one request email. Now we can send from 1 to 5 request emails to different people.
 We have changed the rules how email recipients are found. Now we choose them from page contributors and space admins, sort this list and send the emails to the top 5 people.
{quote}
However, and this comes from a customer's use case:
{quote}the overall concern in this feature is that in some cases people who have contributed to the page, can still see the page, and have 'Restrict' or 'Admin' space permission (sorted by last edit date), might actually be the empty set when the notified admins list is set up.

And then, because to make life simpler admin wise, we have generally granted confluence-admins (i.e. the system admins) admin permission on all the spaces and then there are the space admins that are really the content owners/managers of the space. So for space administrators who can see the page (sorted alphabetically) that set of people is combined and the 5 closest to A in the alphabet are chosen.

We would really like to prefer that people who have space admin NOT via the group of system administrators be sorted in this list above people who are system administrators.
{quote}
This looks like a very solid use case and, thus, this suggestion is opened to actually focus on space admins to be the priority of the notified users when someone asks for access on a restricted page.
fields.summary: Request Access should prioritize space admins to be notified before system admins

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, if you have a page titled *Test Page*, the following search terms will not return the page as a result.
 * Test*Pag*
 * Tes*Pag*

The page will only be returned if the search term explicitly includes the whitespace. For example:
 * Tes* Pag*
 * Te* Pa*

h3. Suggestion

It'd be great if whitespace can be included as part of the wildcard search.
fields.summary: Allow whitespaces to be included as part of a wildcard search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
HTML Unicode characters inserted into a code macro or no format macro are being converted to the ASCII value.
This this does not occur when not placed in a one of those macros but it would seem those macros were made to be able to hold formatting and text without converting any of it.

{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
It was initially thought it was HTML hex entities only, but it appears to be any HTML entity, Hex, Decimal or "named" variant according to customer reports. Further screenshots attached.

{panel}


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test page
 # Paste the following '&#x2f ;' (without the space otherwise it converts here to)
 # Add a code or no format macro and paste '&#x2f ;' (without the space otherwise it converts here to)
 # Notice it's immediately converted to a forward slash

h3. Expected Results
It retains all formatting and characters.

h3. Actual Results
It converts the HTML hex value to it's ASCII symbol

Notes:
List of hex values: http://www.howtocreate.co.uk/sidehtmlentity.html

h3. Workaround
Does not occur in panel or markup macro using Markdown syntax.
fields.summary: Inserting HTML entities in a code or no format macro converts the characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Upgrade Confluence from 6.15.9 to 7.0.2 won't be able to use WebDav.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start up Confluence 6.15 instance (any version before 7.0) 
 # Go to admin page general configuration -> webdav configuration
 # Save on configuration. 
 # Setup Webdav client following this doc.  
 # Upgrade Confluence to 7.0 (any version of 7.0)
 # Go to admin page general configuration -> webdav configuration


h3. Expected Results
WebDav Client is functional 
webdav configuration is accessible

h3. Actual Results
WebDav client shows empty folder 
 !image-2019-10-25-15-16-59-313.png|thumbnail! 
Webdav configuration isn't accessible, showing error below   
 !image-2019-10-25-15-16-03-650.png|thumbnail! 


The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.String cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.WebdavSettings
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.BandanaWebdavSettingsManager.getWebdavSettings(BandanaWebdavSettingsManager.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.BandanaWebdavSettingsManager.getWriteBlacklistClients(BandanaWebdavSettingsManager.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.BandanaWebdavSettingsManager.isClientInWriteBlacklist(BandanaWebdavSettingsManager.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.servlet.filter.ClientWriteDenyFilter.isWebdavClientDenied(ClientWriteDenyFilter.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.servlet.filter.ClientWriteDenyFilter.doFilter(ClientWriteDenyFilter.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.servlet.filter.AbstractHttpFilter.doFilter(AbstractHttpFilter.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:62)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter.lambda$doFilter$0(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:57)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
{code}
select * from bandana where bandanavalue like '%webdav%';
delete from BANDANA where BANDANAID=<id_from_the_previous_query>;
{code}
fields.summary: Upgrade Confluence from 6.15 to 7.0 Webdav is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Inconsistency in Jira Issue Link Count on Confluence Page.
When a *mentioned in* link is removed from Jira, the *Jira link* counter in Confluence page will be removed. Simply re-adding the Jira Issue again into the Confluence page does not trigger the *mentioned in* link to be re-added again.

h3. Replicated Environment
Confluence 6.15.2
Confluence 6.15.8
Jira 7.11.1
Jira 8.3.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Establish Application Links between Confluence and Jira
# Create a new page and insert an Jira Issue Macro with a single issue
# Publish the Page 
(i) Upon publishing the page, Confluence sends a POST request to Jira to add the _mentioned in_ link in Jira Issue:
{code}
2019-10-15 15:33:26,335 DEBUG [Jira remote link executor:thread-36] [org.apache.http.headers] onRequestSubmitted http-outgoing-4110 >> POST /j833/rest/api/latest/issue/ST-2/remotelink HTTP/1.1
{code}
# Verify the *Jira link* on top of the page has 1 count (which is the issue that has just been inserted)
# Verify the linked issue in Jira has *mentioned in* of the page in Confluence
# Manually remove the *mentioned in* link from Jira
# Refresh Confluence page to confirm the *Jira link* no longer shows
# Edit the page, add in _another Jira issue Macro_ with the same issue and Publish the page
(i) At this point the page will have 2 different Jira Issue Macros and both are pointing to the same Jira Issue

h3. Expected Results
Since the Issue has been re-added into the page, Confluence should send the remote link request again so the *Jira link* counter can pickup the issue link again

h3. Actual Results
Confluence does not send the POST request to add the _mentioned in_ link to the Jira Issue thus the *Jira link* still has no count

h3. Workaround
# Remove all Jira Issue Macro(s) that is related to the specific Jira Issue
# Save/Publish the page
# Edit the page again and re-add the Jira Issue Macro

h3. Information
The *Jira link* counter on top of Confluence page get the counts from Jira by sending the request below upon page load:
{code}
2019-10-23 10:55:21,356 DEBUG [JIRAMetadataPlugin_aggregate:thread-3] [http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec] execute Executing request GET /rest/remote-link-aggregation/1/aggregation?globalId=appId%3Dxxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx%26pageId%3Dyyyyyyyyy&globalId=appId%3Dxxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx%26pageId%3Dyyyyyyyyy HTTP/1.1
{code}
Thus, if the *mentioned in* link doesn't exist in Jira's Issues, the *Jira link* count will not display the correct count number
fields.summary: Inconsistency in Jira Issue Link Count on Confluence Page

fields.description: When setting up crowd/confluence there is an option for password policy which includes a regex edit box. We managed to brick our installation by including slashes e.g. the begin and end of the regex. You should parse the regex on submission to avoid needing up. In addition on the next page when creating first admin user I suggest offer a random password based on the regex submitted from previous screen, just in case you have accidentallly submitted a stupid rule in your regex passpword policy.
fields.summary: initial setup- Parse regex password policy + offer password on next page

fields.description:
I'm using Confluence 6.15.2 but this does not seem to have been fixed as of 7.0.2: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-7-0-release-notes-973479448.html].

Adding new attachments to a page creates a new e-mail thread instead of using the e-mail thread generated with create content (POST /rest/api/content). When adding new attachments is done manually, it correctly concatenates to one thread.

This functionality seems to be on Confluence's side: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf615/email-notifications-967338126.html].

"*Email threading*: Confluence will attempt to group all the email notifications about changes to a specific page together."

!image-2019-10-24-17-13-08-798.png|width=598,height=47!
fields.summary: Adding attachments to a page via REST API does not append to existing e-mail thread

fields.description: I've recently automated Confluence report creation. One (or the only) complaint is that adding attachments to Confluence reports causes e-mails to be generated. These are also not batched with the created content e-mail.
fields.summary: Add ability to disable 'Notify Watcher' when adding/updating attachments to a page through REST API

fields.description:
Current functionality for recently viewed pages exists on the dashboard and a user's profile. However, it would be really convenient to have a macro in which Recently Viewed Page can be embedded onto a page. 

I'd want to embed this macro directly on a landing page (i.e., with everything else I have) so that end users can see what they recently visited without needing to navigate off of the page. I'd also like to embed it on the home pages of general spaces so that the macro shows them which pages they recently viewed on that space.

 

Some useful configurations might be:

*Include Space*: If nothing, all pages the user recently viewed would display. Otherwise, if a specific space is referenced, it would show the user only the pages they've viewed on that space.

*Exclude Space*: Does not include viewed pages from specified spaces. If empty, nothing would be exuded.
 *Number of pages*: Default 5, option to increase

*Check boxes* for:
 * Show updated date
 * Show viewed date
 * Show space
 * Show excerpt
fields.summary: Create a macro for Recently Visited Pages

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary On other languages other than English UK, Confluence footer contains an extra character \{2} h3. Steps to Reproduce * Install Confluence with 7.0.1 * Use the Community license as the issue is only reproduced with a Community license * Go to Profile > Change language to other than English UK. These are the languages that's known so far: ** English US ** Dutch ** German h3. Expected Results This is what it looks like when English UK is chosen. Translations of this exact string are the expected result: !CONFSERVER-59043-expected.png|thumbnail! h3. Actual Results Footer contains extra character\{2} Example when choosing German: !image-2019-10-24-21-33-57-321.png|thumbnail!   h3. Notes This is actually caused by the string "licensefooter.community" is translated wrongly in the translations package {code:java} licensefooter.community=Powered by a free Atlassian Confluence Community License granted to {2}. Evaluate Confluence today. {code} Translations package located in \confluence\WEB-INF\atlassian-bundled-plugins\ Where it should be {code:java} licensefooter.community=Powered by a free Atlassian Confluence Community License granted to {1}. Evaluate Confluence today. {code} h3. Workaround Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Footer contains extra character {2} in some languages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Collaborative Editing is ON, users mention for users that have umlauts in their names will not get updated accordingly if they get renamed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new User with umlauts in his name (NOT username), eg: "Ümlauts".
# Mention the user with @mention on a page
# Now Change the name of the user to something different, eg: "Umlauts"
# Reload the page with the @mention and see the displayed name in the @mention is as expectet "Umlauts"
# Edit the page (you will see in edit mode already the old name "Ümlauts"), change something (NOT the @mention) and update the page.
# The @mention on the page gets updated to the old name "Ümlauts" and not "Umlauts"

h3. Expected Results
The @mention on the page gets updated to the new name "Umlauts"

h3. Actual Results
The @mention on the page still remains as "Ümlauts"

h3. Workaround
This behavior is NOT replicable while Collaborative Editing is OFF.
fields.summary: Users (mention macro) that have umlauts in their names doesn't get renamed properly

fields.description:
There was an issue reported in Confluence 7.0.1 where thumbnails were not generated for .tiff images.

As this is actually a feature on Confluence 7.0.1, the information on this was not clear for customers to review. The information regarding enabling the feature of generating thumbnails is only on [Confluence 7.0 Upgrade Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-7-0-upgrade-notes-967869114.html#Confluence7.0UpgradeNotes-Changestothumbnailandpreviewgeneration]. 

It is recommended to make the information [clearer for customers to review|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/display-files-and-images-245827130.html].
fields.summary: Update documentation to mention Confluence no longer generates thumbnails for TIFF or PSD (Photoshop) files by default

fields.description:
from: [Confluence Storage Format|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf66/confluence-storage-format-943961944.html]
{quote}We refer to the Confluence storage format as 'XHTML-based'. To be correct, we should call it XML, because the Confluence storage format does not comply with the XHTML definition. In particular, Confluence includes custom elements for macros and more. We're using the term 'XHTML-based' to indicate that there is a large proportion of HTML in the storage format.
{quote}
When issuing a GET to pull the content of the storage format the response is not really in XTHML as it contains the unexpanded macro confluence tags.
h4. Request

It is requested that functionality be extended to allow a GET call that pulls down content in true XHTML format.
fields.summary: REST needs the ability to GET content in true XHTML format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users insert PDF macro on a page, the macro does not show the content of the PDF. Instead, the following error is returned:
{quote}There was a problem converting this attachment
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head over to a Confluence page.
 # Add a PDF attachment to the page.
 # In the Edit mode of the page, head over to the toolbar > Insert > Other Macros > PDF and Insert the macro to the page.

h3. Expected Results

The PDF macro will display the PDF on the page.
h3. Actual Results

An infinite spinning wheel will be displayed and the following error is returned:
{code:java}
There was a problem converting this attachment
{code}
The following stack trace appears in the logs:
{code:java}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.benryan.conversion.SlidePageConversionData.<init>(SlidePageConversionData.java:23)
{code}
(!) If you are not affected by the error message above but seeing a similar symptom, see also: CONFSERVER-59334 - PDF macro doesn't load PDF content and returns an NPE on readTrailer15 method

Example:
{code:java}
2019-10-29 16:21:17,801 ERROR [DefaultSlideCacheManager:thread-1] [com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask] call problem while converting sample.pdf
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/display/ZZ/eddd | url: /plugins/servlet/pptslide | traceId: ef1f71c974478e3b | userName: admin
java.io.IOException: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:56)
	at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:23)
	at com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask.call(AbstractSlideConversionTask.java:40)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.benryan.conversion.SlidePageConversionData.<init>(SlidePageConversionData.java:23)
	at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:52)
	... 6 more
{code}
or
{code:java}
2019-10-29 16:21:17,801 ERROR [DefaultSlideCacheManager:thread-1] [com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask] call problem while converting sample.pdf
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/display/ZZ/eddd | url: /plugins/servlet/pptslide | traceId: ef1f71c974478e3b | userName: admin
java.io.IOException: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:56)
	at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:23)
	at com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask.call(AbstractSlideConversionTask.java:40)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.benryan.conversion.SlidePageConversionData.<init>(SlidePageConversionData.java:23)
	at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:52)
	... 6 more
{code}
h3. Note

This issue is seen and tested on various PDF files. However, some PDF files are not hit with this issue. At the moment, it is not clear why this is the case.
h3. Workaround

At the moment there is no workaround to the issue.
fields.summary: PDF macro doesn't load PDF content and returns an NPE on SlidePageConversionData
